title: Exploiting cache server normalization for web cache deception
description: To solve the lab, find the API key for the usercarlos. You can log in to your own account using the following credentials:wiener:peter.
solution_steps: In Burp's browser, log in to the application using the credentials wiener:peter .
Notice that the response contains your API key.
solution:
1. In Burp's browser, log in to the application using the credentials wiener:peter .
2. Notice that the response contains your API key.

title: Exploiting exact-match cache rules for web cache deception
description: To solve the lab, change the email address for the useradministrator. You can log in to your own account using the following credentials:wiener:peter.
solution_steps: In Burp's browser, log in to the application using the credentials wiener:peter , then change your email address.
In Proxy > HTTP history , notice that the email change submission form in the /my-account response contains a CSRF token as a hidden parameter.
solution:
1. In Burp's browser, log in to the application using the credentials wiener:peter , then change your email address.
2. In Proxy > HTTP history , notice that the email change submission form in the /my-account response contains a CSRF token as a hidden parameter.
